name: Michael Bass
text: ARAB, AL!! This is an amazing course. Tucked away in a secluded area off a major highway (231). The atmosphere of staff were great. Cart girls and workers were great. We took a group of 12 this year and played Friday, Saturday, and Sunday! ( 90 holes) We stayed at the lake house and enjoyed every second of the time here!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind review!  It was a pleasure hosting your group.  We hope you come back soon!

name: Melissa Cothran
text: What a beautiful course! Tree-line fairways, foothill views, a dam built over 100 years ago, a natural 40 ft waterfall . . . plus great golf!  The staff is friendly, and I recommend their great Southern gourmet burger.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We know we'll see you soon!

name: Gary Dwyer
text: The course is a gem. It's in great condition and absolutely beautiful place to play. You will love it.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Chris Smiddy
text: Beautiful and amazing course!!!! Driving range could've been better since we had to hit off the mats only but there wasn't any rubber tees. There weren't any signs or pictures for the holes posted on the course. They wI'll give you a map upon request, so do so cause it's really detailed and amazing. Definitely look forward to playing again!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back again soon!

name: Louis Tominack
text: Nice layout.  Greens are a bit slow.  Overall nice place to play.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back and play again soon!

name: Kevin Bacon
text: Nice "mountain" course! Pay attention to the book that they give you on insights to each hole!!  Greens in ok shape, t-boxes need to be cut and weeded...

resp.text: Thank you for your review!  We are currently working on many course improvements.  You probably saw that a number of trees were removed and new sod laid in their place.  We hope you come back again when our grounds crew has caught up on all the special projects and has the course in top shape.

name: Jamie Clark
text: Very fun and challenging course to play.  A course that everyone can play by choosing a set of tees that match your skill level.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back again soon!'

name: Dwight Washington
text: The course is in great shape. They changed the layout, what was the front is now the back. Greens were quick, fairways were plush. Give it a try, I think you will enjoy it.

resp.text: Thanks for your kind words.  We hope you come back soon!

name: Will Irby
text: Just in awful condition. The greens are awful, with dead spots and fungus issues. The bunkers are unplayable and full of rocks, the fairways are even in bad shape in several places. We paid $57 to play and it was a waste of money. For $25 I would play it, but it is at least 2x overpriced, if not a bit more. If you are in the area you are far better off going to an RTJ course or driving further to play a different course.

name: Marcia B
text: Love Love this gated golf community.  Like living at a resort with golf, fishing, pool, tennis and the the people are much more than neighbors.  They are friends of the truest sense.  The golf is outstanding and the many community activities are so much fun.  This area is a gem! Also great lodging at the lake house.

name: jay johnston
text: Could be and may have once been a nice course, but the greens were infested with cancer and the sand bunkers were just shy of being unplayable.  Bare lies in fairway and around the greens. This course needs a lot of maintenance before it will be worth $60/18 holes.

name: Andy Forrester
text: Great golf course. Greens are in great condition and the views are incredible.  Friendly staff, good value.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Jeff Szarek
text:
This course came recommended by some people at work. We set up a tee time the day before for Saturday. We traveled about 40 mins to the course. It was right off the highway into a gated golf community. Right from the start we were greeted by the staff. Upon entering the clubhouse, I was amazed at the initial set up of the course. My co-worker had to rent some clubs, at which they were very accommodating by giving him a brand new set of Nike Vapors. I had the Coverts 2.0 from the previous year and was impressed at the rentals they provided. We went to the driving range and then the putting green and we were off. Long story short, the course was AWESOME and the view was even better. We found ourselves stopping to take pictures and taking in the view (Which I rarely do on course). What I thought was to be a 6 hr round (because of our relax play at each hole) was a little over 4 hrs. This course is in my TOP 5 best courses I've played in my life, (I've played in the range of 50-60 different courses). I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys a challenge, but also a forgiving course layout. The scenic views are something out of a movie which as to the relaxation of the game of golf. If you are ever in the area, you have to check out this course.

A big Thank You to the staff there at Cherokee Ridge who were some of the top notch personnel a course can have. Jonathan Watts, a Graduate of the Golf Academy of America Orlando, did not disappoint to the customer service and knowledge one would find at that school.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: R C
text: The clubhouse has excellent food and the course views are breathtaking!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Larry Bryan
text: The sand traps fill with water, almost no yardage markers, no idea where the holes are on the greens, some greens are in bad shape, and they allow groups of 7 to play. Nice layout but not worth the price.

name: Dick Bourget
text: Playing was wonderful

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you play again soon!

name: Screaming Weasel
text: Golf course is equally challenging and gorgeous. Top notch.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: brian jones
text: Several of the greens were bad, always considered this one of the best courses around but it isn’t anymore. Really disappointed.

name: JAMMIE LYNN
text: This course is way over priced for the condition it's in. I paid $61 to play on burnt greens on nearly every hole.  Edges of greens was really bad,  big sand holes you couldn't hit through.  Fairways wa in ok condition.  Most of all, they put out maybe 3 jugs, but only 1 jug had water in it, and that was on the 3rd hole.  We stayed thirsty!! We went  inside to buy a drink, well they had some water made up , but the water made up was also lukewarm.  This course maybe wasn't worth $18 much less $61. Will not be back.  Worst course played in many years of playing.

name: John Woodfin
text: Beautiful golf course and very good food at the clubhouse.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Jon Jones
text: Great course and in great condition!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Jesse Hollingsworth
text: Very pretty course with great scenery. The greens here are some of the toughest greens I have ever experienced. If you are up for a challenge, this is a neat course to play.

name: Kim Melton
text: We had my niece's baby shower at Cumberland today and it was super nice. The place has amazing views and Veronica runs the place top notch!

name: r b
text: My first time there and I was impressed..Veronica is a very good manager...she is on top of the flow of players..

name: Brian Tolzman
text: Veronica was great!  The course was in rough shape. They did have bad weather however don't think that affected the conditions though.

resp.text: Not a correct assessment.  Condition and layout, one of the best in the area at this price point.

name: jullie hallman
text: Beautiful

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

name: Mike Hamner
text: Really nice course, fairways and greens were very playable, challenging layout. Will definitely want to play it again.

name: Michael Dennis
text: Love it such a nice place to hang out and supper friendly  staff!!!

name: Jackie Aronhalt
text: My husband golfed 2 rounds here and loved it! I enjoyed the huge (amazingly clean) pool, food, drinks and view. Awesome!

name: Daniel Banks
text: Great little course. Played it while in Birmingham on business. Greens were a little slow, but rolled smooth. Fantastic layout. Will play again next time in town.

name: Jane Aronhalt
text: New ownership has made amazing turn around. Beautiful course. Love the views. Looking forward to booking a group event.

name: David SMith
text: Course is looking really good! They seem to be making a lot of improvements. Best deal in town at $23 on Tuesdays!

name: Brandon Shirah
text: Love the layout. Course was bought by a group of people and since then they have let the course go a little bit. New new groundskeeper to take pride in the course.

name: Homer Marlowe
text: By far in the best shape it has ever been in thanks to a  new grounds keeper  sent from heaven an new managers that are looking out for the members a great place to jone

name: Parker Cantrell
text: 19th hole has some of the sweetest people around. Worth the trip

name: Lavador Sizemore
text: Beautiful golf course, i worked at this golf course back in 1996 and 97 alot of good memories!

name: Terry Crane
text: Greens are fast. Course in good shape

name: Byron Dixon
text: Very friendly staff. Great rates.

name: Harrison Jones
text: Nice place.

name: L PHILLEY
text: Awesome stuff and awesome customer service! They are always nice and welcoming. I’ve been pleased with all my visits. It’s an awesome place!!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5 star review! We look forward to seeing you next time you stop in and see us!

name: Amos Jackson
text: Stopped by while my wife was at appointment, my son and I was looking for him some Jr. PGA equipment to add to his bag. We were greeted with a smile and a eagerness to help.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars Amos! Hope you see you and your family again very soon!!

name: antwone johnson
text: Mr Danny was AMAZING! Super helpful, very charismatic, knew his stuff and guided me in the right direction with everything! He deserves a raise!!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5 stars Antwone! We really appreciate the kind words regarding Danny and hope that we see you again very soon!

name: Jack Poundstone
text: For the first time, I had a great experience at the PGA Superstore. Danny was incredibly helpful and extremely knowledge about Driver shafts. I could not recommend him more. I never felt rushed or pressured to make a purchase. Go over and ask for Danny or Brooks - both are great.

name: Arlin McCauley
text: Danny at the Birmingham, AL store went above and beyond helping me find the right set of irons. He spent more than ample time switching out irons heads and shafts, giving me many different options. Him being a left handed golfer, like myself, he showed genuine interest in helping me improve my game. He deserves recognition.

name: kelly harcrow
text: Danny L. Was very helpful fitting my son with a new set of irons.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars Kelly! Hope to see you and your son again very soon!

name: Ryland Spitzer
text: This was my first time shopping at this location. I went in with the intention of buying a new set of irons. They were sold out of the irons I had been looking at online so I went to the simulators were two workers were talking and seemed bothered that I walked up and needed assistance. Before I even asked a question I was asked “is your name on the list?” (There were no names on the list) I told him I wasn’t here to get fitted I just wanted to know if they had a demo I could hit a few times. He put together a club and then said we don’t have any available bays. I waited and then another gentleman came up and asked a question about club fitting and the employee that was helping me took him directly to a bay and never once said a word to me. I waited 10 more minutes and I saw bays starting to open however I couldn’t get any help. I set the club down and proceeded to walk out of the store and go directly to Edwin Watts. The employee at Edwin Watts was great and let me hit multiple different clubs and I actually ended up buying a completely different set than what I had intended. ($1200 that Pga Superstore won’t get) My overall advice is to save the trip to Pga Superstore and head to Edwin Watts where you will be treated like you aren’t an inconvenience to the employees.

resp.text:
Hi Ryland,

I would like to apologize for the experience you received while visiting our store. I appreciate you taking time out of your day to make us aware of this situation. I would like to speak with you and see how we can make this right. Please give me a call whenever you get a chance at 205-440-4200 or send me an email at jstephens1@pgatss.com. Joe Stephens- Assistant General Manager

name: michael hooks
text: Shop here  twice a month. Went in last week looking for a new Driver 3 wood and hybrid. There were 2 salesman in one of the bays who saw me pulling clubs and looking at there way for some help. They were having some obvious private  conversation. Never once asked me if I needed help. Stood there for over 20 minutes with no acknowledgement  that I was there. I walked out.

resp.text: Hi Michael, I would like to apologize for your experience. This is not the way we do business and not the experience we want our customers to have. If you would like to come back into the store, I would love to help you myself and make up for the experience you received. My name is Joe Stephens, give me a call at 205-440-4200 or email Jstephens1@pgatss.com

name: Trey Covington
text: This place is horrible impossible to get help I did an in store pick up never got a notification that the order was ready went to the location had to find some help they acted like they’ve never done this type of online in store pick up before I don’t know if they need more training or what. The next day I received an email saying the order was ready what a joke. Hire some better people with better service at this location just horrible. I’ll spend my money online and get better prices anyway

resp.text:
Trey- I apologize for your poor experience. I would like to speak with you further to understand  exactly what happened. Please give me a call at your earliest convenience.

Jerry Ingram General Manager 205-440-4200

name: Nick M
text:
Made the 4 hour trip to get fitted for clubs. As a new golfer, only been playing for 2 months, I figured I could count on PGA Superstore to be able to assist like I needed them to. I wanted to get fitted for a complete bag of clubs. I swung 2 7 irons a total of 15 times and he started picking out clubs for me. I ended up making the mistake of buying clubs yesterday instead of trusting my gut and going somewhere else to be truly fitted to clubs, as I should be. I learned more about why he is a great golfer than why the clubs he was choosing were good for me.

So, in closing, I plan on going somewhere else for the rest of my golf needs.

EDIT: Jerry got me to come back in and get fitted with Drew, fortunately this time it was a better fitting. He spent time and explained things to me unlike the experience before. We did find a few things that we could have changed but they were all minor and could be fixed with more practice.

resp.text: Nick- I am sorry to hear of this poor experience. I would like to speak with you and see how we can make this right. Please give me a call at your earliest convenience at  205-440-4200 or send me an email at jingram@pgatss.com. Jerry Ingram- General Manager

name: Janice Holiday
text: I had the best experience thank you for all the help.

name: Gary Nolan
text: Great place. Great selection and great service!

name: Justin Fountain
text: Allways love the staff here. Best selection in Birmingham. Love the deals on demo clubs.

name: David Anderson
text: Love it ! Best selection of Volvik golf balls .

name: Brian Canady
text: Great items and helpful people.

name: Hailey
text: So I like going here but the service is always questionable. They seem to only greet the men everytime I've gone in there. Guess that's all they cater too.

resp.text: Thanks Hailey! We appreciate the kind words very much.

name: Joni Outlaw
text: Went in to buy a new M6 driver.  Picked it up and it started beeping.  Attendant came and took it, walked away and NEVER asked if he could help or if we were interested in purchasing.  We've decided since you could care less about our business, we will purchase it somewhere else.  We will NOT recommend you to anyone else.

resp.text:
Joni- I apologize for the poor experience you had in my store. I'd like to speak with you about it if you wouldn't mind. I can be reached at 205-440-4200 or jingram@pgatss.com.
Thank you
Jerry Ingram
General Manager

name: Wiliam hays
text:
Had to return shoes purchased in Atlanta.   After reading reviews of this store was not looking forward to it.
SURPRISE,  I was greeted by the young man behind the counter, who took care of my return, without delay or silly questions.  Had a friendly discussion with him.
Looked a golf bags, really helpful sales person, who seemed to know his merchandise.
Went to the shoe section, sales person  Danny L  ask if he could be of help.  Told him what I was looking for, he showed me many pair that worked.  Ended up buying two pair.
Really impressed with the three sales people, ask to speak to the new manager, Jerry Ingram.
He assured me,  what I experienced will be the normal at this store, if I should experience anything less let him know.

name: Joe Johnston
text:
I have never been miserable in a golf store, until now.

The staff reminds me of private club where it is acceptable to wear jorts, wife beaters and smell like they haven't showered in days.

Went in to buy a new set of irons and possibly a driver, could not get a sales person to assist, when I did explained my game and wanted guidance I was greeted with a slack jawed look followed up with, 'these are on sale'.

Best thing for the golf community in BHM would be for this store to go out of business.

name: thebrogdonboy
text: Every time I go they have a massive selection and never what I like. They only keep in stock weird degrees and shaft selections and it is never what they let you demo. Please support a local golf store over this non caring set of employees.

resp.text:
Sir, I’m sorry for our store not having the selection you were looking for. If you would like to schedule a time to shop and work with me individually I would be happy to accommodate you and find the selection you are needing to enhance your game.
Thanks
Jerry Ingram
General Manager
205-440-4200

name: Allie Ingram
text: Great customer service and everything you could possibly need!

name: Jerry Latham
text: Big selections and great staff.

name: Bryan
text:
I was hesitant to visit this store due to the poor reviews online about rude employees and bad customer service, but I visited today with my son who is learning to play golf.  Cory, the manager, was very friendly and helped my son find the right driver, and even gave him some helpful tips. He then took time to show him how to use the computer swing cameras in the hitting bays so he could watch himself and learn what to practice.
He also helped me test a few new grips for my putter and was extremely helpful and friendly. We will definitely visit the store again.

name: Danny Avant
text: Please extend my sincerest appreciation to your sales associate Trey for his assistance and patience yesterday during my and my friends first visit to your store. Without a doubt, he is the most outstanding sales representative I've encountered any where. You've got a real gem in him and I hope you reward him appropriately. Because of him you now have two dedicated customers.

resp.text: Thanks for your awesome feedback!

name: Eric Hutchens
text: This store has great associates and management.

resp.text: Eric- Thank you so much for the kind words. We appreciate you taking the time to compliment our team.

name: Scott Peace
text: My first visit to the PGA store today as I was looking to purchase a new set of clubs for my son. The store is impressive however I was there for 20 minutes and not a single employee asked or offered any assistance. I went to the front and let the gentleman at the front know I was interested in getting a set of Jr Golf clubs and he pointed to a sign at the back of the store that said Juniors. Not sure what I was expecting. I went to the junior department and looked around for 10 minutes before leaving.

resp.text: Hi, we are updating all of our reviews and I wanted to make sure you heard back on this. I am so sorry to hear about your experience and that is not what we pride ourselves on. Please email social@pgatss.com with your contact information. Thanks!

name: Ethan Sullens
text: What's it to love? It's a store. It's a superstore at that! They have a sign that says they provide world class customer service. Clean business. Nice people. It's what's up my friends.

name: Brad 024
text: Their service has improved tremendously and they have great options for all golf gear. Looking forward to continuing shopping with them!

name: Trey Sansing
text: Absolutely horribly service! My friend and i were looking to buy a new set of irons and first off we had to practically beg to be assisted then he gave an attitude when both of us wanted to try clubs but was perfectly fine letting his grandson play on the simulator. I wish this place wasn’t associated with Golf because it will ruin anyone’s preception of golf. Don’t go to this establishment

name: Will Byars
text: Go to Golf Galaxy if you’re in Hoover.

resp.text: HI Will- I'm sorry you had a poor experience. I'd love to speak with you and find out what happened to cause you to feel this way. Please reach out to me at your convenience. Jerry Ingram, General Manager,  205-440-4200 jingram@pgatss.com

name: Todd Workman
text: Great experience, went beyond try to sell you something to really helping with your game, ask for Greg! The staff is extremely knowledgable. I highly recommend dropping buy and looking at this new facility and the inventory is unbelievable.

resp.text: Thanks for your awesome feedback!

name: Payton Ahlemeyer
text: Best value in Birmingham. Friendly staff.

name: Richard Hillenbrand
text: 2nd time to store trying to buy a driver. Unless you are buying a 600.00 driver they are not interested in helping you. Asked for help to fit me for new driver. I hit 3 balls and he was ready for me to leave. Didn't want to help and didn't act like he wanted to be there. After reading other reviews I should have known better than come back a second time. Will never go back!

name: Greg Mcbride
text: Great experience, great help, the manager Jerry Ingram was a very helpful and polite

name: David G. Song
text: Value Price for indoor practice bay, great deals from the store time to time, kind and knowledgable staff helping well from most of in-store experiences.

name: Bamabeachboy2
text:
So in the span of three weeks I drop over $1,000 in the 280 store.....completely upgraded every club in my bag "m2 irons" including a new $150 bag. I purchaced two fairway woods, a putter and a new Bag during my last visit. The cashier charged me twice for the woods....when i questioned it he acted like a jerk and started talking under his breath. I showed him on the receipt because he said "no i didn't". He was to busy chatting with another employee behind the counter to do his job. No big deal the guy just sucks at customer service right. So today I walk in the door at 20 minutes til 6pm. They close at 6pm. I was asked as i walked in the door if I knew what I wanted because they were about to close. Told him i was going to get a new driver needed to get a 10.5 degree. He asked again did i know which one I wanted because they are closing. With a smile i just said no problem I'll go somewhere else.
I will never spend another dime in this store.

Tomorrow I'll drive over to Inverness Golf and pick out my $500 driver for my post father's day gift.
Inverness Golf for me from now on.....don't waste your time or money on these rude idiots. Worst customer service I've ever!

name: Nancy Miller
text:
Wonderful customer service!!  I started a new job, recently. My “dream” job. As I learned my way around the office and got to know my co-workers, I discovered that golf is the unofficial job requirement there, lol. Having never played, I was panicked a little about pursuing this new hobby. I wandered in to the PGA Tour Superstore in Inverness.

As I browsed the store looking at the enormous selection of every kind of equipment I became so overwhelmed. Thankfully a salesperson, Drew, found me. Bless him, he was so patient as I described my predicament. He helped me find the right clubs, bag, shoes, towel, and all the other things a new golfer needs.  He was also patient with my need for things to “match” lol. Golf is an expensive pastime, but Drew made me confident in my decisions. He shared a lot of information about the local golf scene too.

I will definitively be back, and ask for Drew! It’s rare to find this kind of personal attention!  And if my co-workers can’t teach me to play well enough, I’ll be back for lessons!!

name: Dustin Holder
text: Reviews are accurate. Complete ***holes. First thing the guy at the simulator asks when I ask to hit a driver in the range is if I’m in the market with a smirk...

name: JJ Hadder
text: I realize that 7:57 PM is basically 8:00, but why even ask what is it that I needed if your reply was going to be, “we open back up at 10:00 in the morning.” Literally just needed 2 scotty Cameron grips that were right beside the register. C’mon man.

name: Scott Hawkins
text: They do not want to help unless you are buying all brand new clubs. Did not want to help with getting fitted for my irons bc I was not buying new. Said that it would be 24 hours before I could get my clubs back... so I went to Inverness golf and it took 10 minutes. Do yourself a favor and go to Inverness golf on 280.

name: Kevin Hopkins Jr.
text: Amazing store even better customer service!

name: shaggy white
text: Customer service needs to improve. The selections are great though.

name: Frances Stewart
text: Great selection of womens golf gear!

name: Steve Hall
text: A bit pricey!

name: JC Lett
text: What I've come to expect from pga superstores , zero customer service and a bunch of A**holes working there and this location is no different . In fact I made the comment to one of the employees "I don't know how you all stay I'm business" and his reply was with a shrug "then go somewhere else" . There is obviously no service training or much of a screening process in hiring , in Birmingham there is nothing better is only problem , Inverness golf is just as bad

name: Colton Marucci
text: Multiple times misled and given misinformation. Will not go back.

name: Blake Jefferson
text: Every time I go there no one is in there. Probably because their customer service is so terrible. They always make sure to let you know if they are “close” to closing.  If it wasn’t for the younger guy with the glassss I wouldn’t go back.

name: Wayne Zeigler
text: Best chicken sandwich ever.

name: david isbell
text: Employees here ignore you.

name: Sharon Hodgens
text: This place is a bad example for the PGA !

name: Anthony Marino
text: GREAT  Place !
